QuestionStem: The circulatory system of an insect transports water, nutrients, and wastes but does not transport oxygen. Why not?

options.AnswerText: A. The tracheae connect to the circulatory system in the insect body.
B. The insect body absorbs oxygen from nutrients and water.
C. The tracheae deliver oxygen directly to all the tissues in the insect’s body.

CorrectFeedback: The tracheae are internal air tubes that deliver oxygen directly to all the tissues in the insect’s body.
PartiallyCorrectFeedback: Reread the text about how oxygen is delivered to cells in the insect body and try again.
IncorrectFeedback: Reread the text about how oxygen is delivered to cells in the insect body and try again.
FinalIncorrectFeedback: The tracheae are internal air tubes that deliver oxygen directly to all the tissues in the insect’s body.
